newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE sugar ends mixed, Aug closes steadier.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE sugar ends mixed, Aug closes steadier.

text.p: LIFFE sugar futures trading remained subdued during Friday evening trading, although nearby August picked up late to end steadier.
August ended at $321.00 a tonne, up $0.70. Other contracts registered losses of up to $0.60, although total turnover was a paltry 561 lots.
Traders said the late flip-up in August reflected some modest covering ahead of the holidays in the U.K. and U.S. on Monday.
The LIFFE sugar market is closed Monday, re-opening on Tuesday May 27.
